parliamentary_sovereignty.description: Parliament can make or unmake any law, no body can override or set aside legislation
parliamentary_sovereignty.source: Common law principle, established in cases like Factortame

rule_of_law.description: Everyone is subject to the law, including government officials

separation_of_powers.description: Executive, legislative, and judicial functions are separate but interdependent
separation_of_powers.source: Montesquieu's theory, adapted in UK context

human_rights_act_1998.incorporation: Incorporates European Convention on Human Rights into UK domestic law

article_2.application: Protection from unlawful killing, positive obligations on state

article_3.right: Prohibition of torture and inhuman treatment

article_6.application: Criminal and civil proceedings must be fair

article_8.right: Right to respect for private and family life

article_9.right: Freedom of thought, conscience and religion
article_9.application: Includes right to change religion or belief

article_10.application: Includes freedom of press, subject to restrictions

article_11.application: Right to peaceful assembly and join trade unions

precedent.description: Decisions of higher courts bind lower courts (stare decisis)
precedent.hierarchy: Supreme Court > Court of Appeal > High Court > County Courts

equality_before_law.description: All persons are equal before the law

due_process.description: Fair procedures must be followed in legal matters

wales.powers: Primary law-making powers in devolved areas

northern_ireland.powers: Assembly can legislate on transferred matters

brexit.description: UK withdrew from EU on 31 January 2020
brexit.impact: European Convention remains, but EU law no longer directly applicable

retained_eu_law.description: Certain EU laws retained in UK law via EU Withdrawal Act 2018
retained_eu_law.status: Can be amended or repealed by Parliament
